message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "We analyzed the dataset from the World Bank's Enterprise Surveys, which covers more than 140,000 firms in over 140 economies.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise Surveys"], "topic": ["Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the Living Standards and Measurement Survey, we found that access to piped water significantly reduced the number of people living below poverty line in rural areas.", "dataset": ["Living Standards and Measurement Survey"], "topic": ["Water", "Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "This paper presents a new geo-referenced dataset for China that combines various information on extractive industries, deforestation, vegetation cover, and land use change, obtained from satellite imagery and official statistical data.", "dataset": ["geo-referenced dataset for China"], "topic": ["Extractive Industries", "Environment"]}, {"sentence": "The study uses data from PISA 2018 to examine the relationship between teacher-student ratio and student performance in science, mathematics, and reading.", "dataset": ["PISA 2018"], "topic": ["Education"]}, {"sentence": "Drawing on data from the National Affairs Committee's survey of household finances, this article highlights the financial challenges faced by middle-class families in the US in the wake of the COVID-19 pandemic.", "dataset": ["National Affairs Committee's survey of household finances"], "topic": ["Financial Sector", "COVID-19"]}, {"sentence": "Using harmonized cross-country data from the World Income Inequality Database and the Standardized World Income Inequality Index, we find that countries with higher levels of income inequality also have higher incidence rates of mental illness.", "dataset": ["World Income Inequality Database", "Standardized World Income Inequality Index"], "topic": ["Inequality and Shared Prosperity", "Health"]}, {"sentence": "This research employs a unique geo-referenced dataset that combines information on weather patterns, energy supply and demand, and electricity prices across European regions.", "dataset": ["unique geo-referenced dataset"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use data from the International Finance Corporation's SME Toolkit to explore how digital technology can enhance access to finance for small and medium-sized enterprises in low-income countries.", "dataset": ["International Finance Corporation's SME Toolkit"], "topic": ["Digital Development", "Financial Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "Drawing on data from the Demographic and Health Surveys, we investigate the impact of women's empowerment on children's nutritional status in sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Surveys"], "topic": ["Nutrition", "Gender"]}, {"sentence": "This study uses data from the Joint Oil Data Initiative and the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development to assess the effects of global oil price shocks on GDP growth in oil-importing economies.", "dataset": ["Joint Oil Data Initiative", "Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development"], "topic": ["Macroeconomics", "Energy"]}]

content: [{"sentence": "We analyzed the dataset from the World Bank's Enterprise Surveys, which covers more than 140,000 firms in over 140 economies.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise Surveys"], ["International Finance Corporation's SME Toolkit"], "topic": ["Digital Development", "Financial Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "Drawing on data from the Demographic and Health Surveys, we investigate the "dataset": ["Joint Oil Data Initiative", "Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development"], "topic": ["Macroeconomics", "Energy"]}]
